column1: What language is spoken in your field? - Before clicking on the button below, click on the arrow in the right upper corner to select your language
column148: Does your entity have a program to nurture membership through disciple-making?  (such as through devotional resources, spiritual  mentorship, integration into small groups or Sabbath School classes,  etc. )
column149: Does your entity have an active Reclaiming Ministry?
column150: Does Secretariat promote the assimilation and mentoring of newly baptized members? (such as through devotional resources, spiritual  mentorship, integration into small groups or Sabbath School classes,  etc. )
column151: Does Secretariat promote church planting and other mission initiatives in the fields and union institutions?
column152: Are the dates of the executive committee voted in advance and included in the calendar?
column153: Is the mission of the Church a regular point of the agenda (including reports and missionary projects)?
column154: Do the other executive officers play a role in the creation of the agenda?
column155: Are requests for agenda items sent out regularly?
column156: How often do the executive officers review and approve the agendas prior to each   committee?
column157: Are the items of the agenda pre-assigned?
column158: Is the Secretary assisted by a recording secretary during official meetings?
column159: Are voted actions recorded for the minutes during the meeting?
column160: Is the first draft of the minutes written immediately after the meeting?
column161: Is the wording of an action preserved during editing?
column162: Are minutes written in a clear, concise manner?
column163: Are draft minutes reviewed and approved by the executive officers prior to distribution?
column164: Are draft minutes distributed electronically with the agenda to committee members before the next meeting?
column165: Is a minutes distribution list utilized that includes all committee members?
column166: Are the minutes of the previous meeting approved at the subsequent meeting?
column168: Are abbreviations used consistently (currency, entity acronyms, etc.)?
column170: Are the final minutes fully digitizedÂ  and cloud-based? (such as on Amazon, Microsoft, SAP, Dropbox, etc.?)
column171: Are the final minutes of the current year printed, signed and filed in a current binder?
column172: Are the final minutes of the year bound in a hard-copy format?
column173: Is indexing used for the archived minutes?
column174: Are the final minutes also archived permanently in an electronic format?
column175: Is a schedule followed for the backup of electronic minutes?
column176: Is action follow-up assigned and recorded in the minutes?
column177: Are voted action numbers included in the follow-up communication?
column178: Is the date the action was taken included in the follow-up communication?
column179: Is the action wording included in the follow-up communication?
column180: Is action follow-up recorded in writing and kept on file with the minutes?
column181: Is follow-up reported at the next committee meeting, if required?
column182: Are official session announcements published according to policy?
column183: Is a session preparation worksheet being used?
column184: Is a session agenda preparation procedure used?
column185: Is the policy for selecting delegates followed?
column186: Are the delegates notified in a timely manner after being selected?
column187: Is session information sent to each delegate with sufficient advance notice?
column188: Is information sent to the constituency regarding the session?
column189: Are session committees formulated according to the Constitution & Bylaws?
column190: Are recommendations/actions formulated prior to the session?
column191: Are worksheets prepared for the nominating committee?
column192: Are worksheets prepared for the Credentials and Licenses Committee?
column193: Is a current copy of the General Conference Working Policy available for your use?
column194: Is a current copy of the parent organization's Working Policy available for your use?
column195: In general, how often is the parent organization's Working Policy used as a reference?
column196: Are copies of the working policies/operating policies of your of institutions you oversee available for your use?
column197: Are copies of the working policies/operating policies of your conferences/missions available for your use?
column198: Is a current copy of the GC ISE Handbook available for your use?
column199: Is a current copy of the Annual Statistical Report available in print, in addition to by electronic means?
column200: Do you follow published Rules of Order?
column201: Is a personal copy of the Church Manual (print or electronic) available for your use?
column202: Are the entity's quarterly statistical reports submitted on time (January 15, April 15, July 15, October 15)?
column203: Are you using Adventist Church Membership Software (ACMS)?
column204: If using ACMS, are the membership numbers in ACMS the official numbers  being reported to the General Conference Office of Statistics and  Archives?
column205: Is there a designated ACMS Coordinator?
column206: Is the Yearbook information generally submitted on time? (September 30)
column207: Do you submit personnel changes to the Yearbook team as soon as voted? (has to be by email) ?
column208: Did you have a change of organizational unit in the past 5 years?
column209: Did you submit changes of organization units to the General Conference as soon as voted?
column210: Is there a list of all employees?
column211: Are services records on file for all employees?
column212: Are your service records kept and maintained in an electronic system?
column213: Is there a plan to move the service records to an electronic system?
column214: Are originals kept and archived physically, if you are on an electronic service records system?
column215: Are originals scanned and archived digitally, if you are on an electronic service records system?
column216: Is there a schedule for the back up of electronic service records?
column217: Are all entries/reports signed according to policy?
column218: Is a record kept of the names of the service record signatories with their corresponding signatures?
column219: Have gaps in the service records been addressed?
column220: Is there a procedure for managing multiple service records?
column221: Have service records been consolidated so that there is only one service record for an employee?
column223: Do all service records have complete and accurate biographical information?
column224: Is a copy of the service record reviewed by each employee at least every two years?
column225: Do all workers have credentials or licenses?
column226: Are credentials and licenses issued each term?
column227: Does a committee review and approve all credentials and licenses?
column228: Does an officer sign the credentials and licenses?
column229: Does each worker have a separate record with personal information?
column230: How many employees does your organization have?
column231: Are employment ID cards issued to all employees?
column232: Are ID cards with photographs used?
column233: Are employment ID cards issued to probationary employees?
column234: Are there stated procedures for calling regular workers from organizations within your territory?
column235: Are there stated procedures for calling workers from outside your territory?
column236: Are there stated procedures for calling volunteers?
column237: Is there a designated director of Adventist Volunteer Services?
column238: Is there a directory of your organization with email addresses and phone numbers of employees ?
column239: Is there a directory of your subsidiary organization with email addresses and phone numbers of employees ?
column240: Is there a directory of your parent organization with email addresses and phone numbers?
column241: Is there a directory  of all institutional boards, including their  chairs, secretaries, and members with email addresses and phone numbers?
column242: Are there terms of reference for all institutional boards?
column243: Are there terms of references for all standing committees?
column244: Is there a list of all standing committees, including the names of the chair persons, secretaries, and members?
column245: Is there a master schedule of your organization's appointments, itineraries, committees, and boards for the next six months?
column246: Are job descriptions maintained for the Secretary and the office staff?
column247: Do you have disaster policies and procedures?
column248: Are the disaster policies and procedures reviewed and updated regularly?
column249: Are electronic records addressed in the disaster policies and procedures?
column250: Is adequate space provided for Secretariat personnel, filing cabinets, binders and directories?
column251: Is a fire extinguisher available in the officers' work area?
column253: Does the conference/mission have a system for tracking church membership transfers?
column254: Do church membership records include birth/marriage/death/date of baptism information?
column255: Was a church membership audit done within the last five years?
column256: Is there a date scheduled for the next church membership audit
column257: Are you using an electronic system for recording church membership?
column258: Are church membership lists easy to retrieve?
column259: Are church clerk records easy to access?
column260: Are statistical quarterly membership records easy to retrieve?
